snippet: Despite economic choppiness, the country that built the Great Wall is attaining new superlatives in bridges, tunnels, rail links and other projects of immense size — and expense.
abstract: China is forging ahead with large number of ambitious, multibillion-dollar infrastructure projects despite doubts about country's economy; plans include what will be world's longest underwater tunnel, biggest airport, largest bridge and longest gas pipeline; effort is in line with tradition of enormous public works in China, including Great Wall and Three Gorges Dam.
lead_paragraph: Despite economic choppiness, the country that built the Great Wall is attaining new superlatives in bridges, tunnels, rail links and other projects of immense size — and expense.

headline.main: In China, Projects to Make Great Wall Feel Small
headline.print_headline: In China, Projects to Make Great Wall Feel Small
